channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Two-Day Workshop on Binary Reversing & Exploitation to Feature RPI Hacker-in-Residence Jeremy Blackthorne
item.description: Date: Saturday, October 12, 2024 10:00 AM - 6:00 PM - During this hands-on workshop, which covers automating popular binary reversing tools such as IDA, Ghidra, gdb, and angr, students will be provided with a Linux virtual machine which contains all necessary tools and configurations. Workshop materials and instructions will be available for download at 6pm the night before the workshop.

item.title: Book Your COMM+D Appointment Online!
item.description: Are you working on a writing assignment, oral presentation, or visual design project? Whether you’re at the beginning brainstorming stages or finishing up your final revisions, the Center for Global Communication+Design (Comm+D) can help! Just schedule an appointment with a member of our trained staff, then stop by the Comm+D offices on the lower level of Folsom Library.
item.author: Students

item.title: October 15 is Graduate Appreciation Day
item.description: Date: Tuesday, October 15, 2024 (all day) - Both the Office of Graduate Education and Student Life’s Graduate Experience sincerely appreciate the contributions Rensselaer’s graduate students have made, value their dedication and hard work, and thank them for being an integral part of our vibrant academic community! All grad students are encouraged to contact their respective departments to learn about any special “thank you” events taking place that day.
item.author: Students

item.title: Don’t Miss the RPI 2024 Graduate School Expo!
item.description: Join the Center for Career and Professional Development for the RPI 2024 Graduate School Expo, scheduled to be held in the Heffner Alumni House from 1PM to 4PM on October 23! Students will have opportunities to interact directly with various graduate schools and learn more about their programs; register in Handshake to view the participating schools.

item.title: President Schmidt Appointed to CHIPS Industrial Advisory Committee
item.description: Rensselaer President Martin A. Schmidt ’81, Ph.D., has been appointed to the CHIPS Industrial Advisory Committee (IAC). This group of leaders from industry, academia, federal laboratories, and other areas provides guidance to U.S. Secretary of Commerce Gina Raimondo on the nation’s semiconductor research and development initiatives supporting CHIPS for America.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer Researcher Honored for Work in Tantalum
item.description: Rensselaer’s Peter J. Bonitatibus Jr., Ph.D., associate professor of chemistry and chemical biology, has been honored with the Anders Gustaf Ekeberg Tantalum Prize for excellence in tantalum research and innovation. Bonitatibus was presented the award by the Tantalum-Niobium International Study Center (T.I.C.) based out of Belgium at T.I.C.’s 65th General Assembly held in Tokyo, Japan last month.
item.author: Community

item.title: Men’s Hockey Names 2024-25 Team Captains
item.description: The Rensselaer men’s hockey team has announced its 2024-25 leadership group, headlined by Jake Gagnon being named team captain for the second consecutive year. With the honor, Gagnon becomes the first Engineer to wear the “C” in the back-to-back season since John Kennedy in the 2009-10 and 2010-2011 seasons. The team also revealed that Max Smolinski, Elliott McDermott, and Jack Brackett will serve as assistant captains for the upcoming campaign.

item.title: Capital Region AI Plus Symposium Scheduled for October 22
item.description: Register to join the Future of Computing Institute at Rensselaer on October 22 for the Capital Region AI Plus Symposium, a joint effort by RPI and UAlbany that will bring together thought leaders, innovators, and professionals from across the Capital Region and New York State to discuss the impact and future of AI.

item.title: Collegiate Store Announces 20% Off Champion Clothing Sale
item.description: From October 10 through October 15, the Rensselaer Collegiate Store is having a 20%-off sale on Champion clothing and accessories! The discount will be taken at the register and some exclusions may apply; please visit the store for details.

item.title: Rensselaer at Work to Host Virtual MBA for Professionals Review
item.description: Date: Friday, October 18, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Register to join Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., as he reviews this innovative project-based, online MBA for professionals program. Participants will learn to lead from every aspect of an organization with real-world MBA experience, prepare to lead the most dynamic and innovative organizations, and engage, involve, motivate, and lead others to reach their fullest potential.

item.title: Curator Katherine C.M. Adams to Lead EMPAC Tour
item.description: Date: Saturday, October 19, 2024 11:00 AM - Join Katherine C.M. Adams for a behind-the-scenes look at EMPAC’s production facilities as she discusses acoustic and visual potentials of each EMPAC venue for the making of complex performance works, including Bassem Saad and Sanja Grozdanić’s upcoming “Permanent Trespass,” an EMPAC commission premiering at the Center October 25.

item.title: “Winning Foundation Grants” Topic of Faculty/Staff Workshop
item.description: Date: Wednesday, October 16, 2024 3:00 PM - 4:00 PM - Faculty and staff are invited to join Foundation Philanthropy Director Cassie Riger and Sr. Foundation Philanthropy Officer Lori Jancik as they provide an overview of foundation funding, and best practices to apply for and win it! The Foundation Sponsored Research Series is designed for all experience levels. Please contact Jada Williams if you have any questions.
